title: Clarity needs to be addressed.
body:
In game clarity is supposed to be of high priority for RIOT yet it is quite lacking a lot of the time, the following are just a few aspects that i think require attention.

the first is the death recap, i know there is talk of a new re-vamped one, but how far away is it? there must be a temporary fix in the meantime surely.
i personally use the death recap a lot to figure out where the damage is coming from and build against it. but its impossible to do that atm, look at the picture included, kog maw's auto attacks are doing true damage, i happen to know that none of kog'maws abilities let his auto attacks deal true damage and he had no items or buffs that deal true damage. so how did he deal true damage to me?? that is what the death recap needs to show. 

the second is if an ability is cast on terrain that changes hight, in this example the hill of the river bank, the radius and vfx of the ability is hidden, in the picture included, fiora died because she thought she had escaped my (gangplanks) ult  but it was in reality still hitting her and allowed blitz to kill her, as far as in game clarity goes, this is unacceptable, to be frank.

and thirdly, the aoe marker on anivia's Q is to put it plainly.. wrong.
it does not accurately show what is going to be hit by the stun/damage. included is a picture that clearly shows 4 minions within the radius, and yet after the explosion only 1 of them is affected. this does not constitute clarity.

i dont want to be the nagging complainer, but if you're going to use 'clarity' as a reason to do certain things (forget the reason it was announced a while ago, it was to do with justifying some big changes), it needs to be seen across the whole board.
